notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The second part of a festival prayer book.

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, marked with catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square script of the 15th century. Punctuated.

binding.p: Post-1600. Black leather. Spine: 'Machzor. Roman Use. Part II. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 26,955.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile; his manuscript no. 65: his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum in October 1865 for £1,000 throughAdolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153): inscribed, [264v].
